conclusion: Use conservation of momentum and energy to solve the problem
Potential energy of block A at height h is mgh
Kinetic energy at point O is converted from potential energy, so KE = mgh
Velocity of block A at point O is v_A = sqrt(2gh)
Total momentum before collision is mv_A
Velocity of combined blocks A and B after collision is v_AB = sqrt(2gh)/3
Kinetic energy of combined blocks A and B after collision is converted into potential energy
Height to which blocks rise is h' = 1/3 h
Kinetic energy of block A before collision is mgh
Kinetic energy of combined blocks A and B after collision is gh/3
Heat generated during collision is Q = 2/3 mgh
Final answer: heat generated is 2/3 mgh
